instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3_H: What is PPBUS_G3_H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PPBUS_G3_H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No power with charger
threads.message:
Computer has had previous liquid damage.
does work fine on battery.
green has a dim flash about once a second
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_S5_CHGR</SIGNAL> pulses from 0v to 18v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3_H</SIGNAL> also pulses from 0 to 18v
have replaced isl, <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>
no short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_S5_CHGR</SIGNAL>

i don't know where to look on this guy, 
i have been looking over the schematic and i can't seem to find something that will pull the line down every second.
any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No power with charger
threads.message: Sounds like a bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Check all the sense resistors and <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No power with charger
threads.message: I did replaced 6259, ill try to replace it again. For sense resistors, you are referring to the the ones around isl?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No power with charger
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52 <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> are the usual suspects. ACOK should at least come high

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No power with charger
threads.message: Thank you, i will check em out tomorrow!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No power with charger
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> 10
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> 9.9
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> 2.4
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> .3
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 20.2
 <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is pulsing also

is there anything else i should check before replacing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No power with charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No power with charger
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> was measuring 30k instead of 100k
replaced <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> and replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and got green light. and fan spin. i think im in the clear.
